<!--[if lt IE 7]><style type="text/css">body{behavior:url("/w/skins/vector/csshover.min.htc")}</style><![endif]--></head>
<body class="mediawiki ltr sitedir-ltr ns-0 ns-subject page-Kyoto_Protocol skin-vector action-view vector-animateLayout">
		<div id="mw-page-base" class="noprint"></div>
		<div id="mw-head-base" class="noprint"></div>
		<div id="content" class="mw-body" role="main">
			<a id="top"></a>
			<div id="mw-js-message" style="display:none;"></div>
						<h1 id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading" lang="en"><span dir="auto">Kyoto Protocol</span></h1>
			<div id="bodyContent">
								<div id="siteSub">From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</div>
								<div id="contentSub"></div>
												<div id="jump-to-nav" class="mw-jump">
					Jump to:					<a href="#mw-navigation">navigation</a>, 					<a href="#p-search">search</a>
				</div>
				<div id="mw-content-text" lang="en" dir="ltr" class="mw-content-ltr"><p><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:About&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:About (page does not exist)">Template:About</a>
<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Infobox_Treaty&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Infobox Treaty (page does not exist)">Template:Infobox Treaty</a>
<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Infobox_Treaty&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Infobox Treaty (page does not exist)">Template:Infobox Treaty</a>
</p><p><a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:Use_dmy_dates&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:Use dmy dates (page does not exist)">Template:Use dmy dates</a>
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:182px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Kyoto_Parties_with_first_period_(2008-2012)_greenhouse_gas_emissions_limitations_targets_and_the_percentage_change_in_their_carbon_dioxide_emissions_from_fuel_combustion_between_1990_and_2009.png" title="File:Kyoto Parties with first period (2008-2012) greenhouse gas emissions limitations targets and the percentage change in their carbon dioxide emissions from fuel combustion between 1990 and 2009.png">File:Kyoto Parties with first period (2008-2012) greenhouse gas emissions limitations targets and the percentage change in their carbon dioxide emissions from fuel combustion between 1990 and 2009.png</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">Kyoto Parties with first period (2008–12) greenhouse gas emissions limitations targets, and the percentage change in their carbon dioxide emissions from fuel combustion between 1990 and 2009. For more detailed country/region information, see <a href="/w/index.php?title=Kyoto_Protocol_and_government_action&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Kyoto Protocol and government action (page does not exist)">Kyoto Protocol and government action</a>.</div></div></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:182px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Overview_map_of_states_committed_to_greenhouse_gas_limitations_in_the_first_Kyoto_Protocol_period_(years_2008-2012)_(greyscale).png" title="File:Overview map of states committed to greenhouse gas limitations in the first Kyoto Protocol period (years 2008-2012) (greyscale).png">File:Overview map of states committed to greenhouse gas limitations in the first Kyoto Protocol period (years 2008-2012) (greyscale).png</a>  <div class="thumbcaption">Overview map of states committed to greenhouse gas (GHG) limitations in the first Kyoto Protocol period (2008–12):<sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1">[1]</a></sup><br /> Dark grey = Annex I Parties who have agreed to reduce their GHG emissions below their individual base year levels (see definition in this article) <br /> Grey = Annex I Parties who have agreed to cap their GHG emissions at their base year levels<br /> Pale grey = Non-Annex I Parties who are not obligated by caps or Annex I Parties with an emissions cap that allows their emissions to expand above their base year levels or countries that have not ratified the Kyoto Protocol<br /> <br /> For specific emission reduction commitments of Annex I Parties, see the section of the article on <a href="/wiki/Kyoto_Protocol#2012_emission_targets_and_.22flexible_mechanisms.22" title="Kyoto Protocol">2012 emission targets and "flexible mechanisms"</a>.<br /> <br /> The European Union as a whole has in accordance with the Kyoto Protocol committed itself to an 8% reduction. However, many member states (such as Greece, Spain, Ireland and Sweden) have not committed themselves to any reduction while France has committed itself not to expand its emissions (0% reduction).<sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2">[2]</a></sup> As to Greenland: is partly committed through Denmark. However nothing states that Greenland has committed itself to a reduction towards Denmark.</div></div></div>
<p><b>The Kyoto Protocol to the <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_Framework_Convention_on_Climate_Change" title="United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change">United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change</a></b> (UNFCCC) is an international treaty that sets binding obligations on industrialized countries to reduce emissions of <a href="/w/index.php?title=Greenhouse_gas&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Greenhouse gas (page does not exist)">greenhouse gases</a>. The UNFCCC is an environmental treaty with the goal of preventing "dangerous" anthropogenic (i.e., human-induced) interference of the climate system.<sup id="cite_ref-unfccc2005_3-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-unfccc2005-3">[3]</a></sup> According to the UNFCC website, the Protocol "recognises that developed countries are principally responsible for the current high levels of GHG emissions in the atmosphere as a result of more than 150 years of industrial activity, and places a heavier burden on developed nations under the principle of 'common but differentiated responsibilities'."<sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4">[4]</a></sup> There are 192 parties to the convention, including 191 states (all the UN members, except Andorra, Canada, South Sudan and the United States) and the <a href="/wiki/European_Union" title="European Union">European Union</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Ratification_of_Kyoto_5-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ratification_of_Kyoto-5">[5]</a></sup> The United States signed but did not ratify the Protocol and Canada withdrew from it in 2011.<sup id="cite_ref-Canada_withdrawal_6-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Canada_withdrawal-6">[6]</a></sup> The Protocol was adopted by Parties to the UNFCCC in 1997, and entered into force in 2005.<sup id="cite_ref-parties_7-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-parties-7">[7]</a></sup>
</p><p>As part of the Kyoto Protocol, many developed countries have agreed to legally binding limitations/reductions in their emissions of greenhouse gases in two commitments periods. The first commitment period applies to emissions between 2008-2012, and the second commitment period applies to emissions between 2013-2020. The protocol was amended in 2012 to accommodate the second commitment period,<sup id="cite_ref-ritter_2012_doha_talks_8-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ritter_2012_doha_talks-8">[8]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-harrabin_2012_doha_talks_9-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-harrabin_2012_doha_talks-9">[9]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-harvey_2012_doha_talks_10-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-harvey_2012_doha_talks-10">[10]</a></sup> but this amendment has (as of January 2013) not entered into legal force.<sup id="cite_ref-UNamend_11-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-UNamend-11">[11]</a></sup>
</p><p>The 37 parties with binding targets in the second commitment period are Australia, the European Union (and its 28 <a href="/wiki/Member_states_of_the_European_Union" title="Member states of the European Union" class="mw-redirect">member states</a>), Belarus, Iceland, Kazakhstan, Liechtenstein, Norway, Switzerland, and Ukraine. Belarus, Kazakhstan and Ukraine have stated that they may withdraw from the Protocol or not put into legal force the Amendment with second round targets.<sup id="cite_ref-figueres_doha_summary_12-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-figueres_doha_summary-12">[12]</a></sup> Japan, New Zealand, and Russia have participated in Kyoto's first-round but have not taken on new targets in the second commitment period. Other developed countries without second-round targets are Canada (which withdrew from the Kyoto Protocol in 2012) and the United States (which has not ratified the Protocol).
</p><p>International <a href="/wiki/Emissions_trading" title="Emissions trading">emissions trading</a> allows <a href="/wiki/Developed_countries" title="Developed countries" class="mw-redirect">developed countries</a> to trade their commitments under the Kyoto Protocol.<sup id="cite_ref-toth_2001_flexibility_mechanisms_13-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-toth_2001_flexibility_mechanisms-13">[13]</a></sup> They can trade emissions quotas among themselves, and can also receive credit for financing emissions reductions in developing countries.<sup id="cite_ref-toth_2001_flexibility_mechanisms_13-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-toth_2001_flexibility_mechanisms-13">[13]</a></sup> Developed countries may use emissions trading until late 2014 or 2015 to meet their first-round targets.<sup id="cite_ref-14" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-14">[14]</a></sup>
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Developing_countries" title="Developing countries" class="mw-redirect">Developing countries</a> do not have binding targets under the Kyoto Protocol, but are still committed under the treaty to reduce their emissions.<sup id="cite_ref-15" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-15">[15]</a></sup> Actions taken by developed and developing countries to reduce emissions include support for <a href="/wiki/Renewable_energy" title="Renewable energy">renewable energy</a>, improving energy efficiency, and reducing <a href="/wiki/Deforestation" title="Deforestation">deforestation</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-16" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-16">[16]</a></sup> Under the Protocol, emissions of developing countries are allowed to grow in accordance with their development needs.<sup id="cite_ref-berlin_mandate_17-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-berlin_mandate-17">[17]</a></sup>
</p><p>The treaty recognizes that developed countries have contributed the most to the anthropogenic build-up of <a href="/wiki/Carbon_dioxide" title="Carbon dioxide">carbon dioxide</a> in the atmosphere (around 77% of emissions between 1750 and 2004),<sup id="cite_ref-18" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-18">[18]</a></sup> and that carbon dioxide emissions per person in developing countries (2.9 tonnes in 2010)<sup id="cite_ref-iea_2012_per_capita_emissions_19-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-iea_2012_per_capita_emissions-19">[19]</a></sup> are, on average, lower than emissions per person in developed countries (10.4 tonnes in 2010).<sup id="cite_ref-iea_2012_per_capita_emissions_19-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-iea_2012_per_capita_emissions-19">[19]</a></sup>
</p><p>A number of developed countries have commented that the Kyoto targets only apply to a small share of annual global emissions.<sup id="cite_ref-20" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20">[20]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-21" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-21">[21]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-22" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-22">[22]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Dessai_2001_5_23-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Dessai_2001_5-23">[23]</a></sup> Countries with second-round Kyoto targets made up 13.4% of annual global anthropogenic greenhouse gas emissions in 2010.<sup id="cite_ref-24" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-24">[24]</a></sup> Many developing countries have emphasized the need for developed countries to have strong, binding emissions targets.<sup id="cite_ref-25" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-25">[25]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-26" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-26">[26]</a></sup> At the global scale, existing policies appear to be too weak to prevent global warming exceeding 2 or 1.5 degrees Celsius, relative to the pre-industrial level.<sup id="cite_ref-27" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-27">[27]</a></sup>
<a href="/w/index.php?title=Template:TOClimit&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Template:TOClimit (page does not exist)">Template:TOClimit</a>
</p>

<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-23"><a href="#Financial_commitments"><span class="tocnumber">6.2</span> <span class="toctext">Financial commitments</span></a></li>
<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-24"><a href="#Implementational_provisions"><span class="tocnumber">6.3</span> <span class="toctext">Implementational provisions</span></a></li>
<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-25"><a href="#Mechanism_of_compliance"><span class="tocnumber">6.4</span> <span class="toctext">Mechanism of compliance</span></a></li>
<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-26"><a href="#Enforcement"><span class="tocnumber">6.5</span> <span class="toctext">Enforcement</span></a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-27"><a href="#Ratification_process"><span class="tocnumber">7</span> <span class="toctext">Ratification process</span></a>
<ul>
<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-28"><a href="#U.S._position"><span class="tocnumber">7.1</span> <span class="toctext">U.S. position</span></a></li>
<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-29"><a href="#Withdrawal_of_Canada"><span class="tocnumber">7.2</span> <span class="toctext">Withdrawal of Canada</span></a></li>
<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-30"><a href="#Other_states_and_territories_where_the_treaty_is_not_applicable"><span class="tocnumber">7.3</span> <span class="toctext">Other states and territories where the treaty is not applicable</span></a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-31"><a href="#Government_action_and_emissions"><span class="tocnumber">8</span> <span class="toctext">Government action and emissions</span></a>
<ul>
<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-32"><a href="#Annex_I_countries"><span class="tocnumber">8.1</span> <span class="toctext">Annex I countries</span></a>
<ul>
<li class="toclevel-3 tocsection-33"><a href="#Projections"><span class="tocnumber">8.1.1</span> <span class="toctext">Projections</span></a></li>
<li class="toclevel-3 tocsection-34"><a href="#Annex_I_Parties_with_targets"><span class="tocnumber">8.1.2</span> <span class="toctext">Annex I Parties with targets</span></a></li>
<li class="toclevel-3 tocsection-35"><a href="#Annex_I_Parties_without_Kyoto_targets"><span class="tocnumber">8.1.3</span> <span class="toctext">Annex I Parties without Kyoto targets</span></a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-36"><a href="#Non-Annex_I"><span class="tocnumber">8.2</span> <span class="toctext">Non-Annex I</span></a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-37"><a href="#Cost_estimates"><span class="tocnumber">9</span> <span class="toctext">Cost estimates</span></a></li>
<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-38"><a href="#Views_on_the_Protocol"><span class="tocnumber">10</span> <span class="toctext">Views on the Protocol</span></a>
<ul>
<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-39"><a href="#Views_on_the_flexibility_mechanisms"><span class="tocnumber">10.1</span> <span class="toctext">Views on the flexibility mechanisms</span></a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-40"><a href="#Conference_of_the_Parties"><span class="tocnumber">11</span> <span class="toctext">Conference of the Parties</span></a></li>
<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-41"><a href="#Amendment_and_possible_successors"><span class="tocnumber">12</span> <span class="toctext">Amendment and possible successors</span></a></li>
<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-42"><a href="#See_also"><span class="tocnumber">13</span> <span class="toctext">See also</span></a></li>
<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-43"><a href="#Notes"><span class="tocnumber">14</span> <span class="toctext">Notes</span></a></li>
<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-44"><a href="#References"><span class="tocnumber">15</span> <span class="toctext">References</span></a></li>
